intro: Centaurea sintenisiana, commonly known as the Sintenis' centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
